p: Data presented in Table 5 also showed increasing trend in K uptake with successive increase in NPK levels up to 125% RDF. Omission of N/ P/ K significantly decreased the K uptake and it was drastically reduced in N limited plots (69.6 and 76.1% less than that obtained with 100% RDF during year 1 and year 2, respectively), followed by K limited plots (6.3 and 25.4% less than that obtained with 100% RDF during year 1 and year 2, respectively) and P limited plots (17.5 and 45.5% less than that obtained with 100% RDF during year 1 and year 2, respectively). Cultivar P 3522 accumulated significantly highest amount of K in grain, and the lowest accumulation was recorded in Rajkumar in both the years of study. Uptake of K in maize grain varied significantly ( p ≤ 0.01) individually across years, tested cultivars and levels of NPK; however, unlike N and P, the interaction of year × cultivar × levels of NPK had no significant effect on grain K uptake ( Table 5).
